Introduction
The miracle of the Holy Quran is an eternal miracle remaining until the Day of Judgment... The Quran is the seal of the heavenly books... It has no specific era for its miraculous nature nor a specific time; it is a guidance for all humanity... It did not come as a science book... This is a fact we must keep in our minds... But at the same time, it came as an eternal, lasting miracle... Hence, it contains miraculousness for all ages... Miraculousness for those who lived before us, miraculousness for this age of ours, and miraculousness for those who will come after us... Until the world and what is in it ends.
The Quran came to warn whoever is alive... Hence, it is directed to the living... Its challenge is for those residing on this earth... Not for those who have moved from it to the other world... For those see with the eye of certainty... And know the truth after leaving the world.
When His Eminence Sheikh Muhammad Metwally Al-Shaarawy, Minister of Endowments and Al-Azhar Affairs, began writing his articles in Akhbar Al-Youm about the miraculous nature of the Quran... These articles caused a great stir... For they addressed the miraculous nature of the Quran from the creation of the world until now.
His Eminence Sheikh Muhammad Metwally Al-Shaarawy spoke in them about Adam... And how God taught him the names... What is the meaning of God teaching the names to Adam... Then he discussed after that how when a human learns now... he must learn the names first...

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo
text:
His Eminence Sheikh Al-Shaarawy then discussed... Why the Quran was revealed as a comprehensive book for all humanity... And why previous heavenly books were revealed to a specific nation or people to treat a specific ailment... Whereas the Quran is a remedy for the problems of all humanity.
Then he narrated in detail how the Quran tore through the three veils of the unseen... The veil of the past... The veil of the present... And the veil of the future... Indeed, it entered into the human soul... To reveal what a human hides... And does not disclose... And which only God knows.
The Quran then tore through the veils of the near and distant future... Foretelling things the mind did not believe would happen... Or that they could happen... It predicted the outcomes of wars and the destinies of peoples.
It told us that the earth is spherical... And revealed embryology to us before the world knew it... It challenged humanity to create a single fly... And revealed what is smaller than an atom... Note that the word 'smaller' means utmost precision in smallness of size... Because there is small and smaller.
It said: 'And what is beneath the soil,' indicating that there are vast riches in the depths of the earth... Then it informed us about the miracle of creation... And how it happens... And clarified things we have reached through earthly science... And things we have not reached until now.
All of this was explained by His Eminence Sheikh Muhammad Metwally Al-Shaarawy, Minister of Endowments and Al-Azhar Affairs, in an easy, beautiful style... And in a way understandable to every human.
The truth is that this book is considered an important and profound scientific interpretation of some of the Quran's miracles... It is an interpretation that no Imam has addressed until now in this form... And has not been presented in this easy, enjoyable style... It adds to the Quranic library... The library of exegesis, important additions that every Muslim takes pride in...

text:
The Miracle of the Quran
Can Muhammad, peace be upon him, predict the result of a military battle that will happen after seven or eight years... And determine who will win... And who will be defeated... What makes him enter into an unseen matter like this... How does he inform the disbelievers... About what their chests hide... And what their lips have not whispered... And tell the enemies of Islam what will happen to them... And speak about matters of the unseen... What could have happened to the entire issue of faith... If the Quran had not been truthful in every letter it said? But the Speaker is God and the Doer is God.
The Quran is the word of God revealed to His Messenger, our master Muhammad, may God bless him and grant him peace... Recited as an act of worship... And challenging [humanity] with it.
The Quran carries more than one miracle... God challenged the Arabs with it first... Then He challenged mankind and jinn with it... God did not challenge the angels with it... Because angels do not have choices to act upon... Meaning they do only what they are commanded by God... Hence, the Quran challenges all forces that have choice or possess free will... Those whom God distinguished... With the capacity of reason, thought, and choice.
Before we talk about the miracle of the Quran... We must define the meaning of the word 'miracle'.
When a person comes and says he is a messenger from God coming to convey His methodology... Do we believe him... Or do we demand proof of what he says... Therefore, a miracle had to come with every messenger to prove his truthfulness in his message and in his conveyance from God... And the miracle must be something no one else can bring... And...

it must also be in what his people excelled in... Why?... So that it is not said that the messenger challenged his people with something they do not know and have no talent in... The challenge must be in a matter in which the people excelled so that the challenge has value.
Therefore, we notice in the miracle of every messenger that it came in what his people excelled in... And that it came to destroy what they took as a god besides God.
For example, the miracle of Abraham, peace be upon him, came among people who worshipped idols... Prostrating to them and sanctifying them... Therefore, when they wanted to burn Abraham, they brought him before their gods to throw him into the fire... It was assumed that these gods would avenge themselves against the one who destroyed them if they could benefit or harm themselves... But when they threw Abraham, who ridiculed their beliefs, into the fire, the fire did not burn him... And their gods failed them.
Moreover, the choice of fire could have another meaning... How many people worshipped fire in the past... Even during this period... You find some people still taking fire as a holy god.
But Abraham's miracle is not just escaping the fire... For if God wanted to save him from the fire, He would not have enabled them to capture him... Or rain would have fallen to extinguish the fire... But God willed that the fire remain a raging fire... burning... destroying... And that Abraham be taken visibly before all people... And thrown into the fire... And here its burning law or property is suspended ('We said, O Fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham')...

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo
text:
If Abraham had survived by escaping, for example... they would have said, 'If we had caught him, we would have burned him.' And if rain had fallen, they would have said, 'If the rain hadn't fallen, we would have burned him.' But Abraham did not escape... And the rain did not fall... And the fire was raging... Yet it did not burn Abraham.
So it was as if their gods, whom they claimed would take revenge for themselves... were not gods as they claimed... They were merely idols that neither harm nor benefit.
Everything in this universe is subject to God's will... and God's decree. When you say ('O Fire, be coolness and safety'), the property of burning is suspended, and the laws of the universe stand helpless before God's power... And their gods stand helpless to say: 'O fire, burn the one who smashed us.'
Jesus, peace be upon him, came when people knew medicine... So he brought them a miracle of the same kind they excelled in... He healed the blind and the leper... And ascended to something else they did not reach... He raised the dead... So the miracles of the messengers are a breach of the laws or norms of the universe... Fire with Abraham has its burning property suspended... And water with Moses loses its laws... The law of water is leveling (seeking its own level)... It cannot be high in one place and low in another... Its surface must be level... But when Moses struck the sea with his staff... It split, and each part became like a great mountain, standing high to breach all the laws of water.
But why did this happen? Why did the sea split into two parts... And all the laws of water were suspended... Because Moses referred the matter to God... How?... When Pharaoh's people followed Moses' people... Moses' people said, 'Indeed, we are to be overtaken.'... This is realistic talk... Because the sea is in front of them... And Pharaoh's people are behind them. The matter in human law is clear and needs no explanation... But Moses said: 'No'...

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo

He said it with his full mouth... He said it while completely confident... Why?... Because he did not claim he would be saved by human means... He didn't say, 'I will be saved because we will climb such-and-such mountain... or we will cross the sea in such-and-such way.' Rather, he said: ('No, indeed with me is my Lord; He will guide me')... He transferred the matter from human law to God's power... And here God said ('Strike the sea with your staff')... So it split.
The Miracle of the Quran and How it Differs
However, it is noted that the miracle of the Quran differs from the miracles of previous messengers... The miracles of the messengers breached natural laws... challenged... and proved that the one at whose hands they occurred was a truthful messenger from God... But they were cosmic miracles... Whoever saw them believed in them... And whoever did not see them, they became news to him... If he wished, he believed, and if he wished, he did not believe... Had they not been mentioned in the Quran, it might have been said that they never happened.
Thus, the tangible cosmic miracle... meaning the one a human senses and sees... happens once... Whoever saw it believed in it... And for whoever did not see it, it becomes news afterwards... But the miracle of the Prophet, peace be upon him, is a rational, remaining, eternal miracle... Everyone can say Muhammad is the Messenger of God... And this is a miracle, which is the Quran... Another thing, if we look at previous miracles... we find these miracles were an act of God... And an act of God can end after God does it; the sea split for Moses then returned to its nature... The fire did not burn Abraham but returned to

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo

its property afterwards. But the miracle of the Prophet, peace be upon him, is an attribute of God... which is His speech... And an act remains as long as the Doer maintains it... And an attribute remains with the existence of the Doer Himself.
It is also noted regarding the miracle of the Quran... that it differed from the miracles of the messengers in another way... Every messenger had a miracle... and he had a book of methodology (Manhaj)... Moses' miracle was the staff... and his methodology was the Torah... Jesus' miracle was medicine... and his methodology was the Gospel... But the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, his miracle is the very essence of his methodology... So that the methodology remains guarded by the miracle... And the miracle remains within the methodology.
Hence, the books preceding the Quran fell within the scope of assignment (Taklif)... meaning that God Almighty assigned His servants to preserve the Book... As for the Quran, God Almighty said about it: ('Indeed, it is We who sent down the Dhikr [Quran] and indeed, We will be its guardian'). Why?... First: Because the Quran is a miracle... And being a miracle, it must remain with this text, otherwise the miraculousness is lost... Second: Because God tested His servants in preserving previous books... So they forgot a portion of what they were reminded of... And what they didn't forget, they concealed some of it... And what they didn't conceal, they twisted their tongues with it and distorted it from its place... Thus we see there was more than one type of alteration, forgetting, and distortion... Then they brought things from themselves and said they were from God to exchange them for a small price.
Hence, God Almighty decided to preserve the Quran... If we take two lines... The line of applying the Quran... and acting upon its teachings... and the line of preserving the Quran... We see that the line of applying the Quran weakens as time passes... while the line of preserving the Quran increases as time passes... If we were applying

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo

the methodology correctly, this would have been natural... But our negligence of the Quran's teachings as conduct in life does not align with the increasing preservation of the Quran... We find the Quran everywhere... In every home, office, and car... Even the non-Muslim preserves the Quran and carries it... We find a German person, for example, thinking of writing the Quran on a single page... beautifully... Why does he do that with the Quran... before doing it with other heavenly books... And what makes countries like Japan and Italy excel in printing the Quran in a beautiful, elegant form... That happens because God Almighty wants to prove to us that He preserves the Quran... And the further we move away from the methodology... the more we increase in preserving the Quran and caring for it... To prove that the One preserving it is God... not those in charge of the methodology.
The Miracle of the Quran for the Whole World
If we define these three elements that characterize the miracle of the Quran... We then move to another point... The Quran is the word of God recited as worship... It came from the same genre the Arabs excelled in... The people among whom it was revealed... The people of Muhammad, peace be upon him... Known for eloquence and rhetoric... Good performance... Beautiful logic... And fluent expression... So the Quran challenges them in this... When they heard it, they were dazzled... But stubbornness stopped them... They said, 'A magician'... And the response here is very simple... Does the bewitched possess a choice with the magician... If Muhammad was a magician... He bewitched people... So why didn't he bewitch you so that you would follow him... The bewitched does not submit to the magician by his own will... Nor does he come to say

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo

to him, 'I will believe this magic... and disbelieve that magic.' Rather, the bewitched is stripped of will before the magician... So the fact that you say he is a magician while you do not believe in him is proof that you are liars.
Then they said, 'A poet'... Muhammad never recited poetry in his life... And you know that... So why suddenly accuse him of poetry? Then they said, 'Madman'... Is a madman of such character that you don't know what he will do to you in the next minute?... Would a madman be of great moral character like the Prophet, peace be upon him... Whose character they knew well... And whom they nicknamed 'The Trustworthy' (Al-Amin) before the message?
What happened is that they were dazzled... Stunned... They are the kings of rhetoric and eloquence and its pillars... Then came speech that incapacitated them... They found themselves helpless... So they floundered... They said magician... They said madman... And they said things not subject to any logic... Because from the force of the surprise, they lost argument and logic.
The Quran continues the challenge for them to bring something like it... Then it deepens the challenge to say ten surahs... Then it deepens the challenge to say one surah like it... This was the first miracle of the Quran... A miracle that challenged the people among whom it was revealed in what they excelled in... But the challenge in the Quran and its miracles are not for the Arabs alone... Rather, they are for the whole world... Hence, the linguistic miraculousness of the Quran... was its challenge to the Arabs in what they excelled in... But the challenge did not come for the Arabs alone... And the Quran came for all races... And all tongues... So where is the challenge... for non-Arabs... Furthermore, this Book will remain until the Hour is established...

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo

So it must carry a miracle for the world in every time and place. Hence, there were miracles of the Quran... at the time of its revelation and during the period of its revelation... and after its revelation... and they are ongoing... until our present day... They will continue until the Hour strikes to show us God's signs on earth.
The Quran Tore Through the Barriers of the Unseen
When the Quran came, it challenged in many things... First, it tore through the barriers of the unseen... It tore through the barriers of time and space... How so?
The barriers of the unseen are three... First, the barrier of place... Meaning things happen at the same moment... But I know nothing about them... Because they happen in a place... And I exist in another place... Then there is the barrier of past time... Which is something a past time has hidden from me... For I did not witness it... And the barrier of the future, which is what will happen tomorrow... Because the barrier of future time has hidden it from me, so I did not witness it... Thus, the barriers of the unseen are three... The barrier of place... The barrier of past time... And the barrier of future time.
If we read the Quran, we find that it tears through the barrier of past time... It informs us of what happened to previous nations... It narrates to us the stories of previous messengers... It tells us things no one knew... And on whose tongue... On the tongue of an unlettered prophet... Who does not read or write... He tells, then, the secrets of the past... And challenges those who deny... God tore through the veil and barrier of past time for him...

It is sufficient for you to read in the Quran... ('And you were not', 'And you were not', 'And you were not')... to know how much God informed His Messenger of news from the unseen past... ('And you were not on the western side when We decreed the command to Moses')... ('And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should take care of Mary')... Meaning you were not there, O Muhammad... But God is the One who informed you and tore through the veil of past time for you... ('And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan reciting Our verses to them... And you were not on the western side when We decreed the command to Moses... And you were not on the side of the mount when We called, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord')...
Thus we see that the Quran tore through the veil of past time on more than one occasion to inform Muhammad, peace be upon him, of the correct news about the messengers and prophets who preceded him and to correct what was distorted from the heavenly books that God revealed and which the monks and rabbis distorted... Indeed, the miraculousness here came in correcting what happened of distortion to the heavenly books that preceded the Quran.
Muhammad, peace be upon him, used the Quran to challenge the Jewish rabbis and Christian monks... telling them this is from God... in the Torah or the Gospel... and this is what you distorted in the Torah or the Gospel... And they could not face this challenge or respond to it... That is because the challenge of the Quran in tearing through the veil of past time... reached the most minute secrets of past heavenly messages and corrected them for them... And showed what they distorted and concealed... And challenged them to deny what came in the Quran, but they could not... Among that is His saying in Surat Maryam ('That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute')...

text:
Then came the second matter... God tore through the veil of place for Muhammad, peace be upon him... And it came regarding one of the most precise matters, which is the internal dialogue of the self... Here, before we start... I want us to keep firmly in mind that the Quran is the word of God recited as worship... And that it remains without modification or change, no one dares to touch or burn it... Hence, this speech is an argument binding upon Muhammad, peace be upon him, held against him... If the Quran reported something... and it turned out to be incorrect... that would be a destruction of the entire religion.
The Quran comes having clarified the danger of what it says... ('And they say within themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us?"'). What is the meaning of this speech... It means deepening the challenge... The Quran here does not say to them, 'I have torn through the barrier of the past... and informed you of the news of the ancients'... Nor does it say to them, 'I will tear through the barrier of place and inform you of what is happening in a nearby spot you do not see.' rather it says: 'I will tear through the barrier of the self... and inform you of what is in yourselves... what is inside your chests... what your lips have not whispered.'
It would have been sufficient for them to belie Muhammad by saying, 'Our selves did not speak to us about this.' If they hadn't actually said it inside themselves, that would have been the biggest proof to belie Muhammad and announce that he speaks incorrect words... Thus, the Quran, in tearing through the veil of place... entered into the human soul... And into whose souls... into the souls of non-believers who are interested in destroying Islam... And it said in speech recited as worship that will not change or be altered... It said: ('Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allah does not greet you and say among themselves, "Why does

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo
text:
Allah not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination')... God Almighty has spoken the truth... It said what goes on in the souls of non-believers... Is there a greater challenge than this... to the veil of place... It is a challenge beyond the capacity of all human inventions that science has reached now to penetrate the veils of place.
Indeed, the challenge appeared in what non-believers are keen to hide... For when a person is keen to hide something... and is a non-believer... he comes to you and swears to you that this is true... while it is untrue within himself only... But his keenness to hide it from people makes him confirm it is true by swearing... And God Almighty comes and makes the Quran tear through the souls of these people... And reveal what is in them, deepening the challenge... God Almighty says: ('And they will swear by Allah, "If we were able, we would have gone forth with you." They destroy themselves, and Allah knows that they are liars')... And He Almighty says: ('They swear to you so that you might be satisfied with them. But if you are satisfied with them - indeed, Allah is not satisfied with a defiantly disobedient people')... And He Almighty says: ('And they swear to untruth while they know')... Thus, the Quran here came to people who were not believers... And tore through the barrier of the self regarding them, bringing out what was in their chests and exposing them before all people... And exposed their lying... And published to the whole world what was in their chests of lies, hypocrisy, and dissimulation... Meaning it humiliated them before the entire society... Had this been incorrect, these people would have said, 'We did not lie... We are truthful'... And the speech that

Muhammad claims comes from God is incorrect speech... But these people were dumbfounded that the Quran tore through the veil of their souls, so they could not respond... They were dumbfounded because God brought out what was in their chests... And exposed them before all people... So they did nothing more than hide away after their reality was exposed.
Had this Quran been from other than God, it would not have been able to reach inside the human soul... which is one of the most profound secrets of the world that no one has been able to reach until now... Yet the Quran comes challenging with speech worshipped with until the Day of Judgment, in which no one can change a letter, to reveal what is inside the soul... And expose what it conceals from all people... And what it is keen to conceal... Even to the point that they swear by God falsely so people believe them... The Quran comes and tears all this apart... Do you want a miracle greater than that?
Then after that, the Quran tore through the veil of the future... The discussion about the future had to be in several stages... The contemporary stage... So that the people of the message, the believers, and the non-believers would know it is the truth... And the stage of the distant future so that every era that comes after the revelation of the Quran knows... that this is the true Book of God... Hence, the challenge was... for contemporaries regarding close events... And for the world regarding the facts of the entire universe.
Here I would like to draw attention to a very important thing, which is the use of the letter 'Seen' (Sin) in the Quran... The letter 'Sin' as we know in the Arabic language is only used for future events... The Quran is preserved and recited as worship... And will remain preserved until the Day of Judgment... This means it cannot be substituted, changed, or denied by anyone who worships with it... Rather, it will continue to be recited like this as it was revealed... Thus, the Quran's reporting of future events

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo
text:
records these events against the issue of faith itself... And stabs religion in its core... Especially if it turns out that what the Quran predicted is incorrect... Hence, the speaker of the Quran must be certain that this will happen in the future... Who among humans can be certain of what will happen to him after one hour... let alone after days and years?
The answer... No one... That is because human ability to create events is limited... Time has been veiled from them... And place has been veiled from them... If I said, for example, that I will build a building in this spot after a year... I do not guarantee that I will live until the next hour... Thus I cannot judge whether I will be present there or not... This is one thing... Secondly, the government might come, for example, and build a hospital in this place... Or a market or street might be established in this place. So I cannot be certain about a material thing that will happen after a limited period of time.
But the one who can say this with certainty is the one who possesses the power... Hence, He can say with certainty that this will happen after a period of time... And the one who possesses that is God Almighty... If the talk is about what will happen after thousands of years, that is beyond the capacity of all humans... The Quran has foretold what will happen after a few years... And what will happen after thousands of years... The one who said this is the Capable, All-Knowing that this will certainly happen, who is God Almighty.
Look at His saying, Almighty: ('The assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs')... This Surah Al-Qamar was revealed in Mecca while the Muslims were few... and humiliated... Even Umar bin Al-Khattab said: 'Which assembly is this that will be defeated when we cannot protect ourselves?' Thus the Quran predicts that Islam will be victorious... in Mecca

publisher: Al-Mukhtar Al-Islami for Printing, Publishing and Distribution P.O. Box 1707 - Cairo
text:
...And that this assembly gathered to fight Islam in Mecca will be defeated and turn their backs... When does it predict this... While Muslims are few... and humiliated... unable to protect themselves... It states it as a fact... Certain that God who said it will fulfill it.
After that, we find a wonder... Al-Walid bin Al-Mughira, the staunch enemy of Islam... famous for his pride, arrogance, and stubbornness... The Quran comes and says about this arrogant, stubborn human... ('We will brand him upon the snout')... Meaning he will be killed by a blow on his nose... And determines the location of the blow... And after that, he comes at Badr... And you see he has been branded on his snout... meaning struck on his nose... Who can determine the location of the blow and its place... Who can be certain... what will happen after one hour?
Future Events and the Quran's Challenge
We come next to another verse... The Messenger, peace be upon him, comes and recites... ('May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he. His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained. He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame. And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood. Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber')... This is Quran... About whom... About the Prophet's uncle... And about whom... About the enemy of Islam... Could Abu Lahab not have fought Islam with this verse... Could he not have used it as a weapon against the Quran... against this religion... The verse said to him, O Abu Lahab, you will die a disbeliever... You will die a polytheist... And you will be tormented in the Fire... It would have been sufficient for Abu Lahab to go to any group of Muslims... And say I bear witness
